Package lubiku.castleQuest.Model.Parents

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
lubiku.castleQuest.Model.Parents.Entity
lubiku.castleQuest.Model.Parents.Monster
Direct Known Subclasses:
MonsterSlime, MonsterZombie
public class Monster extends Entity

Monster

The Monster class represents a generic monster entity in the game. It extends the Entity class and provides additional functionality specific to monsters. Each monster has an action lock counter and is associated with a GamePanel.

  • Method Details

    • drawMonster

      public void drawMonster(Graphics2D graphics2D, Monster monster)

      drawMonster

      Draws the specified monster on the game panel.
      Parameters:
      graphics2D - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.
      monster - The monster to be drawn.

    • drawMonsterHPBar

      private void drawMonsterHPBar(Graphics2D graphics2D, Monster monster, int screenX, int screenY)

      drawMonsterHPBar

      Draws the HP bar for the monster.
      Parameters:
      graphics2D - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.
      monster - The monster.
      screenX - The x-coordinate of the monster on the screen.
      screenY - The y-coordinate of the monster on the screen.

    • isWithinCameraFrame

      private boolean isWithinCameraFrame(Monster monster, int blockSize, int heroWorldX, int heroWorldY, int heroScreenX, int heroScreenY)

      isWithinCameraFrame

      Checks if the monster is within the camera frame.
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster to be checked.
      blockSize - The size of a block on the game panel.
      heroWorldX - The x-coordinate of the hero in the world.
      heroWorldY - The y-coordinate of the hero in the world.
      heroScreenX - The x-coordinate of the hero on the screen.
      heroScreenY - The y-coordinate of the hero on the screen.
      Returns:
      True if the monster is within the camera frame, false otherwise.

    • updateMonster

      public void updateMonster(Monster monster)

      updateMonster

      Updates the state of the monster, including its actions, collisions, and interactions with other entities.
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster to be updated.

    • interactWithHero

      private void interactWithHero(boolean contactHERO)

      interactWithHero

      Interacts with the hero based on the contact status. If there is contact with the hero and the hero is not invisible, the hero's health is reduced by 1 and the hero becomes invisible.
      Parameters:
      contactHERO - The boolean value indicating if there is contact with the hero.

    • setMonsterAction

      private void setMonsterAction(Monster monster)

      setMonsterAction

      Sets the action for the specified monster. The action lock counter is incremented, and if it reaches the threshold of 120, the monster's direction is randomly set.
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster object for which to set the action.

    • reactionToDamage

      public void reactionToDamage(Monster monster)

      reactionToDamage

      Performs the reaction to damage for the specified monster based on the hero's direction. The monster's action lock counter is reset, and its direction is set based on its type and the hero's direction.
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster object to react to damage.

    • dyingAnimation

      private void dyingAnimation(Monster monster, Graphics2D graphics2D)

      dyingAnimation

      Performs the dying animation for the specified monster by changing the alpha value of the graphics. The alpha value alternates between 0 and 1 to create a blinking effect.
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster object to perform the dying animation on.
      graphics2D - The Graphics2D object to modify the alpha value.

    • changeAlpha

      private void changeAlpha(Graphics2D graphics2D, float alphaValue)

      changeAlpha

      Changes the alpha value of the specified Graphics2D object.
      Parameters:
      graphics2D - The Graphics2D object to apply the alpha value to.
      alphaValue - The desired alpha value. Should be a float between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 represents fully transparent and 1.0 represents fully opaque.
